title: URL's scannable with Status QR code scanner
body:
[comment]: # (Please replace ... with your information. Remove < and >) ### User Story As a user, when I scan a QR code which represents a URL I should offered the choice to open with status or web browser, so that I may access the webpage. ### Description _Type_: Feature [comment]: # (Describe the feature you would like, or briefly summarise the bug and what you did, what you expected to happen, and what actually happens. Sections below) _Summary_: Currently, the QR code scanner handles universal links, user names and ethereum accounts. This feature proposes expanding the QR code scanner to handle URL's which are not preceded with a universal link. The reason is currently accessing a Dapp by scanning a QR code is only possible via universal link. This narrows the QR code scanners ability and puts extra load on dapp developers to either print 2 QR codes (one just a URL and one a status universal link). #### Expected behavior The expected behavior is that a URL which is not a Dapp universal link is handled the same way a URL is handled when tapped on by a user in chat. Scan QR code -> pop up requesting to open in status browser or web browser. #### Actual behavior Currently, scan QR code returns an error notifying the user the QR code scanner will only open universal links, ENS names or Ethereum account addresses. * Open Status * Scan QR code derived from url so www.google.com or https://www.google.com or google.com * Receive error notification ![img!UNITO-UNDERSCORE!0005](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7915365/45166217-66cf6200-b1ee-11e8-8306-9bbd6190b8b4.PNG) ### Solution [comment]: # (Please summarise the solution and provide a task list on what needs to be fixed.) _Summary_: The solution is for QR code scanner to handle URL's in the same as when a link is tapped in chat. ![img!UNITO-UNDERSCORE!0018](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7915365/45422433-16418400-b688-11e8-8692-f0e2dcaa7d3d.JPG) ![img!UNITO-UNDERSCORE!0019](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7915365/45422442-1ccffb80-b688-11e8-8bec-89d0d2ac07cb.JPG) ![img!UNITO-UNDERSCORE!0003](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7915365/45166231-6df67000-b1ee-11e8-953b-b4a74d9562a9.PNG)
![](/images/branding/product/ico/googleg_lodp.ico)
[Google](https://www.google.com/)
Search the world's information, including webpages, images, videos and more. Google has many special features to help you find exactly what you're looking for.
Fixed?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

After working on this QR-related bounty (ui.screens.add-new.models) I have become familiarized with the qr-scanner module. A new branch can be added in `ui.screens.add-new.models` to handle this new case.

Learn more [on the Gitcoin Issue Details page](https://gitcoin.co/issue/status-im/status-react/5776/2560).
